oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Suppression of boron penetration by hot wire CVD polysilicon
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: VAIRAGAR, AV
PATIL, SAMADHAN B
PETE, DJ
WAGHMARE, PARAG C
DUSANE, RO
VENKATRAMANI, N
RAMGOPAL RAO, V
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: cmos integrated circuit
cvd coating
boron
elemental semiconductors
integrated circuit technology
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: In the current and future deep sub-micron technologies, boron penetration through the gate dielectric is a severe reliability concern for the dual gate CMOS technology. In this paper we report results of our attempts to exploit the potential of Hot Wire CVD (HWCVD) for depositing poly-Si gate for CMOS technology. The effect of grain size of poly-Si gate on boron penetration is studied by varying the poly-Si grain size through variation in the HWCVD parameters.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Proceedings of the 9th International Symposium on the Physical and Failure Analysis of Integrated Circuits, Singapore, 8-12 July 2002, 223-226
